New Zealand Herald https://www.nzherald.co.nz New Zealand Herald News Feed 2024 年 7 月 1 日星期一 04:10:07 +0000 zh 1每小时1
Woman dies from liver cancer after regular scans were stopped due to Health NZ system failure https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/woman-dies-from-liver-cancer-after-regular-scans-were-stopped-due-to-health-nz-system-failure/4HQAKJN6VBFUVC5GO2DGJAWSOM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/woman-dies-from-liver-cancer-after-regular-scans-were-stopped-due-to-health-nz-system-failure/4HQAKJN6VBFUVC5GO2DGJAWSOM/ Hannah BartlettPatient had regular scans until 2019 when the surveillance ended.Mon, 01 Jul 2024 04:05:01 +0000 A woman at high risk of liver cancer was supposed to be given appointments for surveillance ultrasounds, but a systems change meant her scans were missed. By the time cancer was detected, it was already advanced and she later died.
Lochearnhead Shears: Wairarapa’s David Buick wins open final in Scotland https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/lochearnhead-shears-wairarapas-david-buick-wins-open-final-in-scotland/NAFKHLVY6ZDLPKGPDDLLX5Z7TA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/lochearnhead-shears-wairarapas-david-buick-wins-open-final-in-scotland/NAFKHLVY6ZDLPKGPDDLLX5Z7TA/ Doug LaingBuick wins the open final but Scotland takes the Joe Te Kapa Memorial Trophy. Mon, 01 Jul 2024 04:00:00 +0000 The line-up after Scotland won the latest Joe Te Kapa Memorial Trophy shearing test match at the Lochearnhead Shears in Scotland at the weekend. The New Zealand team of shearers Jack Fagan (left), David Buick, and manager Mark Barrowcliffe, Te Kapa's daughter, Emily Te Kapa, and the Scotland team of Calum Shaw and Hamish Mitchell.

Mon, 01 Jul 2024 03:32:11 +0000 Some of the members of Kāpiti College's kapa haka group Kia Āio te Noho, from left, Bee Veale, Ahurei Hapeta-Taereau, Maysen Pappafloratos, Maia Takurua-Truscott and Te Huirangi Peita.
Rangitīkei District Council bringing roading and water services in-house https://www.nzherald.co.nz/whanganui-chronicle/news/rangitikei-district-council-bringing-roading-and-water-services-in-house/RYUMXZIX4NAPLNQCLTWMUQKESE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/whanganui-chronicle/news/rangitikei-district-council-bringing-roading-and-water-services-in-house/RYUMXZIX4NAPLNQCLTWMUQKESE/ Rangitīkei District Council bring roading and water services in-house. Kāinga Ora chief executive Andrew McKenzie resigns: Government changes at state housing agency not what he signed up for – chairman https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/kainga-ora-chief-executive-andrew-mckenzie-resigns-government-changes-at-state-housing-agency-not-what-he-signed-up-主席/JWQFG6MNP5D7PJGO7QJW6NL6ZE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/kainga-ora-chief-executive-andrew-mckenzie-resigns-government-changes-at-state-housing-agency-not-what-he-signed-up-主席/JWQFG6MNP5D7PJGO7QJW6NL6ZE/ Raphael FranksThe Government announced sweeping changes at the agency in May. Mon, 01 Jul 2024 03:15:26 +0000 Kāinga Ora chief executive Andrew McKenzie will leave the agency at the end of October, chairman Simon Moutter said in a statement.
